column1: The overloading of regular set of operators for regular or custom types (structures/classes).
To prevent memory leakage problems it is better to  use smart pointers rather than raw pointers.
It's preferred to avoid multiple inheritance (excepting abstract classes) to prevent runtime issues

Some of language constructions have non-declared behavior according to the ISO standard. In case of any error, it's not possible to predict further behavior. It depends on a platform environment, runtime context, etc.
Choose one of the popular editors and study it well. For example: Notepad++, Atom, etc.
Choose one of the popular editors and study it well. For example: Visual Code, Atom, Sublime Text, etc.
Choose one of the popular IDEs and study it well: Eclipse, MS Visual Studio, Qt Creator, JetBrains Clion, XCode, etc.
Knowledge of features and abilities (shortcuts, tools, plugins)
Learn about common errors (segfault, out of memory, access violation) and undefined behavior concept.
The ability to work with a debugger via command line is a not common skill. It's sufficient to work with it via IDE. For example: set conditional breakpoints, etc.
Study how to use a debugger and all its features
Compilation of sources to object files (compilation)
The compiler performs several stages of code compilation. It's good to know about all of them to better understand compilation issues. Deep knowledge is needed for compiler creators only.
Each compiler has its nuances. It's good to know about them to prevent getting any trap: Clang++/LLVM, Intel C++, MSVS C++, GCC, MinGW
Carefully read the terms of the license agreement.Your project must comply with them.
It's also good to know how to calculate algorithm complexity and memory consumption.
To configure automated code formatting verification with one of the suitable utilities: clang-format, Resharper - code style, MSVS - code style.
Naming conventions, tabs vs spaces, etc.
Composition is preferably than the inheritance
Skill to read existing code sources
Do not ignore warnings from compiler or any code analyzer. They are your friends, not enemies.
Creation of a software deployment package
Sometimes it's needed to provide an ability to reuse a library written in a different language from another one. For example: to call C++ libraries in C#.

The C++ is still one of the most popular development languages. There is quite a number of people that want to start learning it and become a C++ developer. They face questions like: "Where should I start? What and in what order should I study? What books should I read?"   We tried to answer these questions in the presented roadmap. The map focuses on general competencies and skills that could be found in most projects. It is designed to help those who are just starting their education or have little experience. You can create a more productive learning plan without being distracted by side information if you study the set of listed materials. It will help you to master C++ at the level that is used in many commercial projects.   More information: https://github.com/salmer/CppDeveloperRoadmap
Reviewers: - https://github.com/marleeeeeey - https://github.com/MolinRE - https://github.com/SD57 - https://github.com/SergeiSkliar - Community :)
The middle developer has the skills to create a design for new functionality as a part of a component or application, if even there're not enough requirements or lack of information.
The juniors should be aware of middle/senior skills. It's enough to have a basic understanding of them.

If you have any feedback or remarks don't hesitate to contact us. We really appreciate it. :)   To contact us choose one of the following Github approaches: - For any remarks related to repository content - go to Pull Requests and submit a new one - For any remarks related to the Miro roadmap - go to Issues and submit a new one (As a framework has no history tracker it was decided to limit a "write" access to this roadmap. All remarks will be added after its review and acceptance).
The senior developer has the skills to create a design and make decisions for a solution or component, taking into account a business area context.
The junior should acquire the following skills as soon as possible: to write easy-readable and well-structured code.
The "steps" are presented on this map. They're intended to show an easy for newbies to be able to get confident base knowledge about the language at the beginning.
Ability to gather, analyze, evaluate information and make decisions based on it.
Calmly react to what people say. Most likely that they only consider their own context when they try to prove something. This is fine. Evaluate the usefulness of their point of view.

Take challenging tasks in order to develop your skills and competencies, even when there is not enough knowledge/experience (skills will develop much faster through such tasks). The main thing is to distinguish a really useful complex task that will help you to boost your skills from a dumb task that requires a scapegoat.

You should be responsible for your professional development. Don't wait for the team lead to decide for you what to study. Do not forget that blind adherence to someone else's plan will sharpen your skills according to requirements of a particular company. It is better to discuss and build in your interests into the plan. If this is not done, there is a high risk of getting irrelevant skills, which will hit career opportunities. But don't overdo it: don't study absolutely everything or don't passively wait until a development plan will be created for you.
The ability to provide the amount of information that is necessary to communicate to people with different backgrounds.
Providing information to people outside the team
Ability to communicate ideas and thoughts within the team

At first, some of the skills may seem impossible to develop. However, we think differently. It is possible to work on each of the skills. Everything depends on your desire and internal blocks. Everything is individual, and it's up to you to decide. :)

If you read this it means you already understand why it is so important :)   Usually, it is required at least to read because you would need to understand technical documentation. But as you move up the career ladder, you will need to speak and write more confidently in English.
Look for like-minded people and join/create a community for experience exchange.
Understanding the distribution of roles in a team
Assigning and clarifying tasks to employees
You should study and observe contemporary trends to be competitive, as well as being able to adapt to them.

Experienced developers should develop management skills and business communication skills to complete tasks efficiently. It is easier to do if you have developed emotional intelligence. For a junior developer, the skill is also useful to better interact with colleagues.
